repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
`gx` did not work on tags in help buffers to open the documentation of that tag in the browser.

Solution:
Get the `optionlink`, `taglink` and `tag` TS nodes and create an extmark with url property for them. `gx` then works OOTB.

Closes: #35420
Closes: #35422

comment_data.body: I've kept the `parser` and `root` definition outside the `do...end` blocks so the code for "runnables" and for the gx implementation share those. Can also be repeated if that's cleaner.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -66,51 +66,85 @@ vim.keymap.set('n', '[[', function()
   require('vim.treesitter._headings').jump({ count = -1 })
 end, { buffer = 0, silent = false, desc = 'Jump to previous section' })
 
--- Add "runnables" for Lua/Vimscript code examples.
----@type table<integer, { lang: string, code: string }>
-local code_blocks = {}
 local parser = assert(vim.treesitter.get_parser(0, 'vimdoc', { error = false }))

comment_data.body: Should I add a test that _tests_ a URL to see if it's valid using `vim.net.request`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+local t = require('test.testutil')
+local n = require('test.functional.testnvim')()
+local Screen = require('test.functional.ui.screen')
+
+local eq = t.eq
+
+describe('gx works for tags', function()
+  local screen --- @type test.functional.ui.screen
+  local link_ns
+
+  before_each(function()
+    n.clear({ args = { '-u', 'NORC' } })
+    screen = Screen.new(64, 16)
+    n.command('help nvim.txt')
+    link_ns = n.api.nvim_create_namespace('nvim.help.urls')
+  end)
+
+  it('creates extmarks for optionlink, taglink and tag nodes', function()
+    t.neq(0, #n.api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(0, link_ns, 0, -1, {}))
+  end)
+
+  it('points to https://neovim.io/doc', function()
+    local link = n.api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(
+      0, link_ns, 0, -1, { limit = 1, details = true }
+    )[1]
+
+    local url = link[4].url
+    eq(true, vim.startswith(url, 'https://neovim.io/doc'))
+
+    local param = url:match("%?tag=(.*)")
+    local tag = n.api.nvim_buf_get_text(0, link[2],link[3], link[4].end_row, link[4].end_col, {})[1]
+    eq(vim.uri_encode(tag), param)
+  end)

comment_data.body: for now let's put `gx` tests in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/f1a8bb45cafc518d5607618eec7fa05abd773b81/test/functional/lua/ui_spec.lua#L140 , even if they are filetype-specific.

can be a single it()

```suggestion
    it('gx on a help tag opens URL', function()
      n.command('helptags $VIMRUNTIME/doc')
      n.command('help nvim.txt')
      local link_ns = n.api.nvim_create_namespace('nvim.help.urls')

      -- creates extmarks
      t.neq(0, #n.api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(0, link_ns, 0, -1, {}))
```

     end)

+      end)
+
+      it('points to https://neovim.io/doc/', function()

comment_data.body:
can drop this since the assert below depends on it...

this is a good example of why spreading out tests in different it() can lead to noise
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -180,5 +180,30 @@ describe('vim.ui', function()
         end, { n.testprg('printargs-test'), 'arg1' })
       )
     end)
+
+    it('gx on a help tag opens URL', function ()
+      clear({ args = { '-u', 'NORC' } })
+      n.command('helptags $VIMRUNTIME/doc')
+      n.command('help nvim.txt')
+      local link_ns = n.api.nvim_create_namespace('nvim.help.urls')
+
+      -- creates extmarks
+      t.neq(0, #n.api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(0, link_ns, 0, -1, {}))

comment_data.body: the `-u NORC` is necessary to let the ftplugin have effect. Without this line, the test faills (0 extmarks created). Would it be better to change the clear() in before_each to have `-u NORC`?

does it work with `--clean` ? i.e. change line 16 to:

    clear{ args_rm = { '-u' }, args = { '--clean' } }

comment_regular_data.body: Thanks for the guidance and feedback @justinmk!

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: gx in help pages opens tag documentation in the browser
